newsitem.title: UK: EBRD nine month operating profit up 63 pct.
newsitem.headline: EBRD nine month operating profit up 63 pct.

text.p: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development operating profit rose 63 percent to 69.7 million Ecu ($89.24 million) in the first nine months of 1996.

The bank, which was set up to aid transition to the market economy in central and eastern Europe said in a statement that it made a net profit after provisions of 2.2 million Ecu compared with a net loss of 1.8 million a year ago.

"The third quarter financial results indicate consistent progress towards sustainable profitability and illustrate the EBRD's solid and long-term commitment to cost effectiveness," said Bart le Blanc, vice president in charge of finance at the bank.
The bank continued its policy of making provisions against its investments as it undertakes more projects in countries which are in the early stages of transition to market economies.
Provisions rose 52 percent to 67.5 million Ecu.

Its spending also rose, to 46 commitments worth 1.1 billion Ecu in the first nine months of this year, compared with 918 million in the year ago period, while disbursements of money rose to 898 million from 750 million.

The EBRD's banking and equity portfolio in the region is continuing to expand its contribution to the development bank's revenues and rose to 40 percent of total income, le Blanc said. -- David Chance London newsroom 44 171 542 5887 ($1=.7810 Ecu)
